metadata.title: CVE-2022-31117 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
UltraJSON is a fast JSON encoder and decoder written in pure C withbindings for Python 3.7+. In versions prior to 5.4.0 an error occurringwhile reallocating a buffer for string decoding can cause the buffer to getfreed twice. Due to how UltraJSON uses the internal decoder, this doublefree is impossible to trigger from Python. This issue has been resolved inversion 5.4.0 and all users should upgrade to UltraJSON 5.4.0. There are noknown workarounds for this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-ujson - 1.33-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
python3-ujson - 1.33-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ujson package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.33-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
pandas package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
